inclusion.criterion: acromegaly due to growth hormone secreting pituitary adenoma
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: fail to achieve endocrinologic remission at 3 months after surgery
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: residual tumor is confirmed by clinicians on brain MRI scan at 3months after surgery
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: normalization of age-matched insulin growth factor-1 level
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: contraindication of stereotactic radiosurgery; e.g. pregnancy or planning pregnancy, or claustrophobia
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: limited life expectancy due to systemic disease; e.g. malignant tumor, genetic disease, and terminal stage of renal or hepatic failure
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: disability to clinic visit due to postoperative complications
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a known case of Acromegaly who underwent transsphenoidal surgery 4 months ago. He came to the clinic for follow-up lab studies after his primary resection surgery.
